alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Central Phoenix; Deer Valley; East Valley; New River Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Pinal County; Northwest Valley; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:56PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 500 PM MST... At 356 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Peoria to Camelback Ranch to near Phoenix International Raceway to 7 miles west of South Mountain Park. Movement was west at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Peoria, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, El Mirage, Tolleson, Youngtown, Waddell, Laveen, Cashion, Sun City, Wittmann, New River, Tonopah, Sun City West, Circle City and Litchfield Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 91 and 152, and between mile markers 159 and 163. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 238. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Phoenix.
